com.sap.conn.idoc

Interface IDocRecord

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDocDocument, IDocSegment

    public interface IDocRecord
extends Serializable
    Interface that serves as a basic instance for accessing structured IDoc data elements.

    • Method Summary

      String[][] toFieldNameStringValueArray(String[][] nameValueArray, boolean withoutEmptyFields, AtomicInteger returnedFields)
      Returns a two-dimensional String array containing the names and string values of all fields from this record in proper sequence (from first to last field).

    • Method Detail

      • checkFieldValue

        void checkFieldValue(int index)
              throws IDocSyntaxException
        Checks if the record field element at the specified index position contains a valid value. Therefore the type safeness and a possibly defined value ranges will be checked.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the record field element to be checked.
        Throws:
        IDocSyntaxException - the record field element at the specified index position does not contain a valid value.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • checkFieldValues

        void checkFieldValues()
               throws IDocSyntaxException
        Checks if all record field elements contain valid values. Therefore the type safeness and possibly defined value ranges will be checked.
        Throws:
        IDocSyntaxException - if at least one record field element does not contain a valid value.

      • disableFieldDatatypeChecking

        void disableFieldDatatypeChecking()
        Disables the immediate field datatype checking for the record. If disabled, no datatype check is done for a single field when it is set.

        Caution: This method should be used with care. Sending IDocs with illegal field contents that are violating the field's defined datatype may cause ABAP system dumps and result in unrecognized partial loss of data when later being processed in an AS ABAP system.

        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • disableFieldValueChecking

        void disableFieldValueChecking()
        Disables the immediate field value checking for the record. If disabled, no value check is done for a single field when it is set.

      • enableFieldDatatypeChecking

        void enableFieldDatatypeChecking()
        Enables the immediate field datatype checking for the record. If enabled, a datatype check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocConversionException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • enableFieldValueChecking

        void enableFieldValueChecking()
        Enables the immediate field value checking for the record. If enabled, a value check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocSyntaxException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.

      • getBigDecimal

        BigDecimal getBigDecimal(int index)
                  throws IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element at the specified index position as a BigDecimal object.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as a BigDecimal object.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to a BigDecimal object.

      • getBigDecimal

        BigDecimal getBigDecimal(String name)
                  throws IDocFieldNotFoundException,
                         IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element with the specified name as a BigDecimal object.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as a BigDecimal object.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to a BigDecimal object.

      • getDate

        Date getDate(int index)
      throws IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element at the specified index position as a Date object containing a date or time value. In case that the associated record field is of datatype UTCLONG the returned Date object contains a full timestamp.
        Note: A returned Date object containing a timestamp has a reduced precision with the split seconds from the originating UTCLONG record field always being rounded down to milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as a Date object containing a date, time or timestamp value.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to a Date object.

      • getDate

        Date getDate(String name)
      throws IDocFieldNotFoundException,
             IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element with the specified name as a Date object containing a date or time value. In case that the associated record field is of datatype UTCLONG the returned Date object contains a full timestamp.
        Note: A returned Date object containing a timestamp has a reduced precision with the split seconds from the originating UTCLONG record field always being rounded down to milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as a Date object containing a date, time or timestamp value.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to a Date object.

        IDocRecordMetaData getRecordMetaData()
        Returns the record's meta data.
        Returns:
        the record's meta data or null if it is not available.

      • getTime

        Date getTime(int index)
      throws IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element at the specified index position as a Date object containing a time value. In case that the associated record field is of datatype UTCLONG the returned Date object contains a full timestamp.
        Note: A returned Date object containing a timestamp has a reduced precision with the split seconds from the originating UTCLONG record field always being rounded down to milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as a Date object containing a time or timestamp value.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to a Date object containing a time or timestamp value.

      • getTime

        Date getTime(String name)
      throws IDocFieldNotFoundException,
             IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element with the specified name as a Date object containing a time value. In case that the associated record field is of datatype UTCLONG the returned Date object contains a full timestamp.
        Note: A returned Date object containing a timestamp has a reduced precision with the split seconds from the originating UTCLONG record field always being rounded down to milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as a Date object containing a time or timestamp value.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to a Date object containing a time or timestamp value.

      • getValue

        Object getValue(int index)
         throws IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element at the specified index position as an Object instance. Depending on the datatype of the record field element the method returns the following object:

        Datatype  Returned object type
        STRING String
        NUMERICString
        INTEGERBigInteger
        DECIMALBigDecimal
        DATE Date
        TIME Date
        BINARY byte[]
        UTCLONGString

        If no meta data is available, the value of the record field element will always be returned as a String object.

        Parameters:
        index - index of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as an Object instance.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to an Object instance.

      • getValue

        Object getValue(String name)
         throws IDocFieldNotFoundException,
                IDocConversionException
        Returns the value of the record field element with the specified name as an Object instance. Depending on the datatype of the record field element the method returns the following object:

        Datatype  Returned object type
        STRING String
        NUMERICString
        INTEGERBigInteger
        DECIMALBigDecimal
        DATE Date
        TIME Date
        BINARY byte[]
        UTCLONGString

        If no meta data is available, the value of the record field element will always be returned as a String object.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the record field element to be returned.
        Returns:
        the record field element's value as an Object instance.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.
        IDocConversionException - if the field value could not be converted to an Object instance.

      • isFieldDatatypeCheckingEnabled

        boolean isFieldDatatypeCheckingEnabled()
        Checks if the immediate field datatype checking for the record is enabled. If enabled, a datatype check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocConversionException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Returns:
        true if immediate datatype checking for the record is enabled; false if it is disabled.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • isFieldValueCheckingEnabled

        boolean isFieldValueCheckingEnabled()
        Checks if the immediate field value checking for the record is enabled. If enabled, a value check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocSyntaxException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Returns:
        true if immediate field value checking for the record is enabled; false if it is disabled.

      • setValue

        void setValue(int index,
              byte[] value)
       throws IDocConversionException,
              IDocSyntaxException
        Sets the given byte[] object as value for the record field element at the specified index position.
        Parameters:
        index - the index position of the record field element to set.
        value - the value to set for the record field element.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocConversionException - if the immediate field datatype checking is enabled and the given value could not be converted into the datatype of record field element at the specified index position.
        IDocSyntaxException - if the immediate field value checking is enabled and the given value is invalid for the record field element at the specified index position.

      • setValue

        void setValue(int index,
              char value)
       throws IDocConversionException,
              IDocSyntaxException
        Sets the given char character as value for the record field element at the specified index position.
        Parameters:
        index - the index position of the record field element to set.
        value - the value to set for the record field element.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

        IDocSyntaxException - if the immediate field value checking is enabled and the given value is invalid for the record field element at the specified index position.

        void setValue(int index,
              short value)
       throws IDocConversionException,
              IDocSyntaxException
        Sets the given short number as value for the record field element at the specified index position.
        Parameters:
        index - the index position of the record field element to set.
        value - the value to set for the record field element.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).
        IDocConversionException - if the immediate field datatype checking is enabled and the given value could not be converted into the datatype of record field element at the specified index position.
        IDocSyntaxException - if the immediate field value checking is enabled and the given value is invalid for the record field element at the specified index position.

      • toFieldNameStringValueArray

        String[][] toFieldNameStringValueArray(String[][] nameValueArray,
                                       boolean withoutEmptyFields,
                                       AtomicInteger returnedFields)
        Returns a two-dimensional String array containing the names and string values of all fields from this record in proper sequence (from first to last field). The array elements of the returned String[][] are assigned as follows:
            String[0] = array_of_field_names;
    String[1] = array_of_field_values;

    String[0][0..n] = field_name_#n;
    String[1][0..n] = field_value_#n;
        If all fields of this record fit into the specified array, they are returned therein. Otherwise, a new String array is allocated whose size is equal to the number of fields in this record, i.e.
            nameValueArray = new String[2][IDocRecord.getNumFields()];
        It is not guaranteed that the specified array remains unchanged in cases where it is too small and a new String array is allocated and returned. It is allowed to specify null for the String array argument.

        If all elements of this record fit into the specified array with room to spare (i.e. the specified array has more elements than this record has fields), both elements in the array immediately following the last copied field elements are set to null. This is useful for determining the filled length of the returned array when looping over it. However, one may also determine the number of returned elements by passing an AtomicInteger object to this method which then acts as an additional return parameter containing the number of copied name and value elements. If this additional return value is not needed, it is allowed to specify null for the AtomicInteger argument.

        With the boolean value argument, one may choose if all fields of this record shall be returned in the String array, or if fields with empty string values shall be skipped and not be returned.
        Parameters:
        nameValueArray - the String array into which the elements of this record are to be stored, if it is not null and if it is big enough; otherwise, a new String array is allocated and returned instead of this one.
        withoutEmptyFields - true if fields with empty string values shall be skipped and not be returned; false if all fields shall be returned with possibly also containing empty string values.
        returnedFields - the number of fields contained in the returned String array, or null if it is not needed.
        Returns:
        a String array containing the names and string values of the fields from this record.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.13
        See Also:
        getNumFields()
